summary: This document is an email chain from July 24-25, 2019, reporting that Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch. It also notes that Epstein's cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him, and the incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck, placed on suicide watch, and reportedly threatened by his cellmate.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Associate Warden at MCC New York
persons.context: Advised the reporting party about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein in the prison.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.role: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sent the initial report about the Epstein incident received from the Bureau of Prisons.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York reported on Epstein's condition and status in the prison.
The Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal relayed information about Epstein's incident to other parties.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck, escorted to medical, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Cellmate Threat Reported
events.description: Epstein's cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him, as advised by the Associate Warden.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on the morning of July 24, 2019, with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein's cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him, according to the Associate Warden.
The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP).
The report was forwarded via email on July 25, 2019, by a Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal.
